summary: This is a court order from the Southern District of New York authorizing attorneys to bring specific electronic devices (HP laptops) into the courthouse for use in the trial of United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell. The authorization covers the period from November 29, 2021, to January 15, 2022, and grants WiFi access in Courtroom 318.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order (United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell, S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

events.title: Device Authorization Period for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Court-authorized period for attorneys to bring specific HP laptops into the SDNY courthouse for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial proceedings.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a court order authorizing electronic devices for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial (case S2 20 Cr. 330).
The authorization period spans from November 29, 2021, to January 15, 2022.
The order grants WiFi access for specific HP laptops in Courtroom 318 of the SDNY courthouse.
The document references Standing Order M10-468, which governs the use of electronic devices in the courthouse.
The order indicates active trial proceedings were scheduled or ongoing during late 2021 and early 2022.
